description: Conversion of existing single dwelling house into x 3 residential units (1 x 1 bed, 1 x 2 bed and 1 x 3 bed); single storey rear extension (following demolition of existing rear conservatory), installation of one window to front elevation, and installation of windows to side elevation; with associated landscaping, refuse and cycle storage.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawing(s) and document(s):  Site and Roof Plan, Cycle Storage and Bin Storage as proposed, Drawing Number PR-P-100-0, Revision A, dated 03/05/20147; Ground Floor Plan as proposed 1/2, Drawing Number PR-P-100-1, dated 03/05/2017; Ground Floor Plan as proposed 2/2, Drawing Number PR-P-100-2, dated 03/05/2017; First Floor Plan as proposed, Drawing Number PR-P-101, Revision A, dated 03/05/2017; Second Floor Plan as proposed, Drawing Number PR-P-102, Revision A, dated 03/05/2017; Front and Rear Elevations as proposed, Drawing Number PR-E-01, Revision A, dated 03/05/2017; Side Elevation as proposed and diagrammatic profiles, Drawing Number PR-E-02, dated 03/05/2017;  Sections 'A', 'B' and 'C' as proposed, Drawing Number PR-S-01, Revision A, dated 03/05/2017; 10 Buxton Gardens Planning Design and Access Statement, prepared by RJHArchitecture
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwellinghouse, and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of The London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013)

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with approved plan Site and Roof Plan, Cycle Storage and Bin Storage as proposed, Drawing Number PR-P-100-0, Revision A, dated 03/05/20147 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in the curtilage of the proposed building and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

REASON: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD  (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Cycle storage for a minimum of five (5) bicycles shall be provided onsite in accordance with approved plan Site and Roof Plan, Cycle Storage and Bin Storage as proposed, Drawing Number PR-P-100-0, Revision A, dated 03/05/20147, and all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
REASON: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| Before the development hereby permitted is brought into use, the new windows shown on the SIDE ELEVATION AS PROPOSED as depicted on Side Elevation as proposed and diagrammatic profiles, Drawing Number PR-E-02, dated 03/05/2017shall be fitted with obscured glazing, and any part of the window[s] that is less than 1.7m above the floor of the room in which it is installed shall be non-opening. The windows shall be permanently retained in this condition thereafter.

REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (2016), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012
